11.title: Sam Puckett

choices: ...start cooking and force-feed me everything you make

111.content:
There’s nothing like it. The wide open inner-city roads, the clear blue skies, the mighty eardrum numbing engine roaring at her feet as it thrusts the bike forward. Sam Puckett couldn’t possibly feel more complacent than she does now.

Sure the babysitting services does rile up a hoot every now and then with an adventure to some usually strange location in the town, but just getting out of earshot of Cat’s blathering voice really helps clear her mind and let her be.

Coming to a stop along the boardwalk, Sam parks her hog on the nearby wooden bench. She reclines, relaxed, soaking in the sun’s UV rays and breathing in the fresh ocean air.

All was right with the world…until, “Hey!”

Startled, Sam snaps her head to the source of the sudden noise. Within her sight, she saw a rather tall Latino girl, about the same age as Sam, angrily trudging towards her.

Sam greeted with a simple, “What?”

“Don’t ‘WHAT’ me! What are you doing riding on my turf?”

“Your turf? I don’t see your name all over the road.”

The girl huffed, crossing her arms, “Don’t get smart with me!”

“Well, don’t get stupid with me,” Sam retorted.

“Don’t talk to me like that!”

“Don’t, don’t, don’t. Why don’t you ‘DO’ something and bug somebody else, ya lanky-.”

Enraged, the girl’s face turned as red as a tomato. Her fuse had been lit.

With one swift motion the girl kicked Sam in the chest and onto the wooden planks of the boardwalk. With the velocity she moved at Sam tumbled a bit.

“Leave!”

Anger slowly rising within her being, Sam spat and brushed off her leather jacket.

“Oh no, Sister!”

Sam bum rushed the girl and threw a flurry of right and left hooks only to be grappled and thrown right into her bike, knocking it over.

Sam struggles to stand upright. The taller girl leers into her eyes, sending a look of evil intent.

“Get out of my turf before it’s too late, scrawny.”

Defeated, Sam hops onto her bike, mumbles, and zooms away.

————————————————————

“Gasp, Sam! What happened to you?!?” Cat questioned at Sam’s roughed up appearance.

Sam hobbles through the door and didn’t make it far before she crashed on the couch groaning in pain, “Some chick at the boardwalk threw me into my bike for riding on “her turf”.”

“That’s awful! …wait. You didn’t beat her up? She beat you up?”

“I could’ve, but…she was bigger…than me…”

“But, you’re Sam Puckett. You never lose a fight.”

“I didn’t lose the fight. We’re just in-between rounds right now.”

“Oh! So is it not to late to see it on pay-per-view?”

Sam grumbles at Cat’s ignorance, “I just need to make some adjustments to myself. Then I’ll when.”

“Hmm, well, since the girl was taller than you, you could borrow you 3ft high heels I purchased from Skymart.”

“There you go with the dumb ideas again!”

“Or…you could…maybe try to outweigh her? You know since making you taller hurt a lot. Those shoes are pretty uncomfortable.”

Sam’s face brightened, “Cat that-that…actually makes sense. I only lost because I was disadvantaged. All I need to do is just, but on a few pounds and then I’ll crush her like the lanky, dirty, ugly-”

“Sam. Mind your temper.”

“Right. Right.”

“So what are you going to do?”

“Cat, I know what I NEED to do, but I first I want you to…”

1241.content:
“Cat, I am home.” Sam shouts as she barges through the front door. She glanced down at the flier in her hand. Cat poked her head out from the kitchen.

“Hi Sam. How was your ride.”

“It was good, I found this weird flier for some contest on my ride though.”

“What type of contest?”

“It is called the biggest in town contest, apparently it is some sort of weight gain contest. The prize is 50,000 dollars and a six month modeling contract.”

“That is a lot of money, are you thinking about entering?”

“I can't, locals only.” She said sadly.

“Well that stinks, we could do a lot with 50,000 dollars.” She pouted.

“You could do it, you're local.” Sam said hopefully.

Cat looked shocked. “I don't know Sam.”

“It didn't have to be permanent, I will help you lose the weight when it is over.” Cat frowned, conflicted. “Bibbles.”

“What!?” Cat gasped.

“I will buy you bibbles.” She said with a smirk as she stalked up to her.

Cat bite her lip. “What do I have to do?”

info.brief_description: An adipose take on the popular Nickelodeon show, Sam & Cat.
info.description:
Sorry for the rash introduction, but I'm not sure how to do it right.

Rules

The rules follow along most weight gain interactives.

-Realistic and Unrealistic Weight Gain is allowed. Although, the unrealistic gain needs to be reasonable. I.E. No 20 pounds of fat gained from a pizza.

-Keep the characters in character please. I would recommend watching a few episodes first so you can get a feel.

-Mild sex is allowed. Like touching and making out. Nothing further should be included.

-No Male Weight Gain (sorry ladies...and fellas.)

-No other forms of expansion allowed.

-Actually, the weight gain can be semi-bizarre

Have fun and happy writing!
